thread.title: Prisoner found dead in Strangeways prison has been named
thread.title_full: Prisoner found dead in Strangeways prison has been named

author: Charlotte Dobson
title: Prisoner found dead in Strangeways prison has been named
text:
Prisoner found dead in Strangeways prison has been named The deceased prisoner has been named this morning as 28-year-old Tomasz Nowosad Share Get daily   
An investigation has been launched after an inmate was found dead in his cell in Strangeways prison. 
The deceased prisoner has been named this morning as 28-year-old Tomasz Nowosad. 
Guards at the Category A jail were called to a cell shortly before 8.30pm on Thursday. 
Prison service watchdogs will now investigate how the young inmate came to his death. 
The circumstances surrounding his death are not believed to be suspicious. 
A Prison Service spokesperson said: “HMP Manchester prisoner Tomasz Nowosad died in custody on Thursday 2 February. Read More Prisoner found dead in cell at Strangeways prison 
“As with all deaths in custody, there will be an independent investigation by the Prisons and Probation Ombudsman.” 
Sources from inside the prison say that shocked staff discovered Nowosad’s body in a cell on the prison’s A-wing. 
The man’s death is the second prison fatality in Greater Manchester in the last week. 
On Sunday an inmate collapsed and died at Salford’s Forest Bank prison. 
Another prisoner at Forest Bank had been taken to hospital on Saturday after being found collapsed. Read More
